sources.title: Let's Get Tough
sources.description: The East Side Kids fight the "Japs" in this WWII propanda piece.

sources.title: Let's Get Tough!
sources.description: Title: Let's Get Tough! Summary: The East Side Kids take on a gang of Japanese spies. Directed by: Wallace Fox Actors: Leo Gorcey, Bobby Jordan, Huntz Hall Production Company: Banner Productions Release Date: 29 May 1942 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Outraged by the attack on Pearl Harbor, Muggs, Danny, and the rest of their gang want to enlist. Turned away because of their age, they take out their frustration by harassing an Asian shopkeeper. When the shopkeeper is found dead soon afterward, the boys learn that he was Chinese, not Japanese. Determined to atone for their behavior, the gang stumbles across evidence that a real group of Japanese spies is operating in the area, and they become determined to expose them. Meanwhile, Danny is troubled further by the news that his older brother has been dishonorably discharged from the Navy.

sources.title: Let's Get Tough! (1942)
sources.description: Rejected by the Army, Marines, and Navy for being too young, the punks help the war effort by throwing fruit at a shop they believe is owned by a Japanese American. Confronted by him wielding a short sword, the gang decides to come back at night but find him dead. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/lets-get-tough-1942/

sources.title: Let's Get Tough
sources.description: The East Side Kids take on Japanese and German saboteurs.

sources.title: Let's Get Tough! (1942) THE EAST SIDE KIDS
sources.description:
Stars: Leo Gorcey, Bobby Jordan and Huntz Hall 
Director: Wallace Fox

The East Side Kids take on a gang of foreign spies.

metadata.Plot: Outraged by the attack on Pearl Harbor, Muggs, Danny, and the rest of their gang want to enlist. Turned away because of their age, they take out their frustration by harassing an Asian shopkeeper. When the shopkeeper is found dead soon afterward, the boys learn that he was Chinese, not Japanese. Determined to atone for their behavior, the gang stumbles across evidence that a real group of Japanese spies is operating in the area, and they become determined to expose them. Meanwhile, Danny is troubled further by the news that his older brother has been dishonorably discharged from the Navy.
